title: Helplines, squads & penalties: Are UGC's new equity rules need of the hour or overkill?
description: Heads of universities and colleges are no longer just administrators; they are now the first line of accountability in preventing and responding to discrimination. New structures, new reporting mechanisms, and strict timelines are written into the rulebook, backed by the threat of serious penalties for non-compliance. Yet, as has often been the case with regulations aimed at correcting long-standing social inequities, the real questions lie beneath the stated intent.

title: Indian killed in US: How a timely call by a 12-yr-old from inside closet saved lives
description: A tragic shooting in Lawrenceville, Georgia, has claimed the lives of four people, including an Indian national. The incident stemmed from a family dispute. A brave 12-year-old child's quick thinking and 911 call alerted authorities. Police arrived swiftly, leading to the arrest of the suspect. The children present escaped unharmed. The Consulate General of India in Atlanta is providing assistance.

He highlighted personal challenges with documentation and warned that the underprivileged and minority communities are most at risk of exclusion.

He also talks about his experiences of working with director Saran and actor Ajith Kumar, with whom he forged a superhit combination, and why he currently loves music composer Anirudh.

title: IndiGo vacates over 700 slots at domestic airports after DGCA's 10% cut order
description: IndiGo has released over 700 airport slots nationwide, including major metros like Delhi and Mumbai, following a DGCA-mandated 10% cut to its winter schedule. This action aims to curb disruptions after thousands of passengers were affected by cancellations and delays in early December. Other airlines are now invited to utilize these released slots.

'I wanted to scream': Two sisters share their story of agony, pain & fight against it
description: When both parents suffered strokes a year apart, twin sisters Aishwarya and Apoorva became caregivers, transforming their Mumbai home into a testament to courage and resilience. They navigated medical crises, emotional turmoil, and the profound reversal of roles, ultimately finding strength and deeper bonds through unwavering love and support for their parents.

title: US winter storm: Air India cancels all flights from New York, New Jersey on Jan 25-26; details
description: Air India has cancelled all flights to and from New York and Newark on January 25 and 26 due to a severe winter storm forecast. The airline cited safety concerns for passengers and crew as the storm is expected to bring heavy snowfall and icy conditions to the US East Coast.

title: Infosys to employees: Share data about your electricity bills
description: Infosys is now collecting household electricity data from employees working remotely to enhance its sustainability efforts. This initiative aims to accurately measure the environmental impact of hybrid work and refine clean energy strategies. The company, already a leader in renewable energy sourcing, seeks to further reduce its carbon footprint by understanding home energy consumption patterns.

description: A 24-year-old man, Faizan, was fatally shot in a targeted cafe attack in northeast Delhi. A chilling confession video emerged, with a suspect claiming personal revenge for a past insult, denying family involvement or financial motives. Faizan's brother alleges a prolonged dispute and accuses both the suspect and his father, seeking swift justice.

This coincides with a resurfaced documentary clip of a lone penguin, dubbed 'Nihilist Penguin,' sparking online debate about existentialism and rebellion, though scientists attribute the behavior to disorientation or illness.

Budget 2026: What banks and financial services expect from FM this time?
description: The banking sector anticipates targeted policy support in Union Budget 2026 to address credit constraints and rising NPAs in unsecured loans. Key expectations include enhanced MSME credit guarantees, co-lending schemes, and continued digital financial inclusion support. The industry also seeks incentives for pension and insurance adoption and regulatory relief for rural banks.

title: Children hid in closet: Indian national, 3 relatives shot dead in family dispute in US
description: An Indian national was among four people killed in a Georgia shooting linked to an alleged family dispute. Police identified the suspect as Vijay Kumar, who has been charged with multiple counts, including murder. Three children were found unharmed inside the residence and are now in family care.

Sabotage? Explosion damages Amritsar–Delhi railway line in Fatehgarh Sahib; loco pilot injured
description: A suspected sabotage incident rocked the Amritsar-Delhi railway line in Punjab late Friday night. An explosion near Khanpur village, Fatehgarh Sahib, damaged approximately 12 feet of track, injuring a freight train's loco pilot. Authorities are investigating the blast, which occurred around 12:30 am Saturday. Restoration efforts are underway with enhanced security.

description: Murder convicts Priya Seth and Hanuman Prasad were forced to change their wedding venue from Alwar's Barodameo town due to intense media and public scrutiny after their wedding card went viral. The couple, both serving life sentences, tied the knot at an undisclosed location on Friday, with their lawyer confirming the ceremony proceeded as planned despite the venue change.

Despite bowling struggles, the team restricted New Zealand to a manageable total.

Diary entry reveals why a NEET aspirant from UP amputated his foot
description: A 24-year-old man from Jaunpur allegedly severed part of his left foot to claim disability benefits for NEET medical admission. Initially reporting an attack, police uncovered his motive through his diary and girlfriend's statement, revealing his desperation for MBBS admission. He reportedly used a machine and possibly anesthetics for the act.

Bengali? Yes, SIR. Brahmin? Yes, SIR. Go, fall in line
description: Bengal's voters, including Mukherjees and Banerjees, face hearings over "logical discrepancies" in surnames. The Election Commission's software flags historical variations like Mukhopadhyay for Mukherjee, a simplification by the British. Many now prefer shorter versions, leading to confusion and summons, prompting criticism from CM Mamata Banerjee about cultural insensitivity.

MLB trade rumors: Yankees likely to move on from power-hitting duo
description: The Yankees are poised to spend big on a veteran bat, potentially impacting top prospects Jasson Dominguez and Spencer Jones.  With an outfield crowded by established stars, these young talents might be traded to contenders seeking high-upside talent. This move signals New York's win-now mentality, prioritizing immediate impact over long-term development.

Ammonia spike in Yamuna disrupts tap supply across city; residents may struggle till February
description: Thousands of Delhi households face prolonged water disruption as treatment plants operate below capacity due to high ammonia levels in the Yamuna. Residents report dry taps for days, relying on expensive water cans, with concerns the crisis could extend into next month.  The situation is exacerbated by canal closures and a lack of dedicated ammonia removal facilities.

title: Meta’s most famous employee reveals what he hated most about company he worked for 12 years
description: Yann LeCun, Meta's former chief AI scientist, revealed he "hated being a director" during his 12-year tenure at the company. The Turing Award winner left Meta in November last year to launch his own AI startup, citing frustrations with management duties and disagreements over the company's heavy investment in large language models, which he calls "a dead end" for achieving superintelligence.

title: Josh Allen injury update: Bills QB faces uncertainty amid possible surgery concerns
description: Buffalo Bills General Manager Brandon Beane has provided an update about Josh Allen's injury. According to him, the star QB may undergo right-foot surgery. Furthermore, the Bills have faced a serious crisis on their offensive line. The star quarterback has injured himself in their last game against the Denver Broncos.

title: Reggie Miller says Stephen Curry should call Giannis as Father Time looms
description: Reggie Miller urged Stephen Curry to recruit Giannis Antetokounmpo to the Warriors, citing Milwaukee's struggles and the Warriors' need for star power after Jimmy Butler's injury. Miller believes this blockbuster move could save Curry's prime and reshape the league, combining two of the game's biggest stars for a championship push.

title: Buffalo Bills fans rally to bring back ex-coach Sean McDermott after firing
description: A passionate Buffalo Bills fan, Maria Maisonet, created a Change.org petition to reinstate head coach Sean McDermott, accumulating over 45,000 signatures. The fan believes McDermott’s dismissal is short-sighted, overlooking his contributions and player respect. She argues McDermott deserves a chance to coach in the new stadium [New Highmark Stadium]. Bills owner Terry Pegula sensed something in the locker room, which led to McDermott’s firing.

title: Netflix rejects Paramount’s offer, says nothing else other than Oracle’s backing
description: Netflix co-CEO Greg Peters dismissed Paramount Skydance's $108 billion bid for Warner Bros. Discovery as unrealistic, citing its heavy reliance on debt. He contrasted it with Netflix's more stable $82.7 billion all-cash offer, which is gaining traction with shareholders.  The potential merger faces significant Hollywood and regulatory scrutiny.

title: Davos 2026: Musk, Trump reconcile at memorial; policy rift on US solar energy emerges
description: Elon Musk and Donald Trump have reportedly reconciled, attending a memorial together in September 2025.  Despite this apparent truce, Musk recently diverged from Trump's stance on energy at the World Economic Forum, advocating for solar power to meet America's growing electricity demands, a move contrasting with Trump's pro-oil policies.
